1.title: Request for review and feedback on login page specification
1.description: The business analyst has requested the development team to review the attached login page specification and provide feedback regarding any unclear or technically difficult aspects. No response or acknowledgement is present in this email.
1.evidence_quote: Please review it and let me know if anything is unclear or technically difficult to implement.

2.title: Clarification needed on minimum password length
2.description: Gábor Horváth requests clarification on whether the minimum password length for the login page should be 8 characters, as in other modules. No answer provided yet.
2.evidence_quote: I don't see any mention of the minimum password length. Should it be 8 characters, like in other modules?
2.subject: Project Phoenix - New Login Page Specification

3.title: Google SSO implementation not included in estimate
3.description: The specification includes Google SSO, but this feature was not confirmed with the client and is not supported natively by the current system. Implementing it will require extra effort and was not included in the original estimate.
3.evidence_quote: Implementing this will require extra effort, as our current user management system doesn't support it natively; we'd need to pull in and configure a separate library. This wasn't included in the estimate.
3.subject: Project Phoenix - New Login Page Specification

12.title: Unclear error handling for payment gateway failures
12.description: Developer is unsure how to handle TIMEOUT or INVALID_CARD errors from the payment gateway due to missing specification details. This is blocking progress on integration.
12.evidence_quote: what should I do if the gateway TIMEOUT or INVALID_CARD errors? I couldn't find this in the specification.
12.subject: Payment gateway API integration - error messages
12.resolution_evidence: For INVALID_CARD: redirect to the payment page with a clear message: "Incorrect card details, please check!". For TIMEOUT: also back to the payment page, but the message should be "Payment failed due to timeout, please try again."

13.title: Unaddressed API rate-limiting handling question
13.description: Eszter Varga asks if the team has discussed how to handle API rate-limiting and what should happen if too many requests are sent in a short time. No answer is provided in this email.
13.evidence_quote: By the way, have we discussed the API rate-limiting issue yet? What happens if we send too many requests in a short time? Do we need to handle this?
13.subject: Payment gateway API integration - error messages
13.resolution_evidence: Okay, thanks for the quick help! I'll get it done today.

14.title: GDPR compliance issue: newsletter checkbox default
14.description: Client has requested urgent modification to ensure newsletter subscription checkbox is unchecked by default during registration, as current implementation violates GDPR.
14.evidence_quote: According to GDPR, this must be unchecked by default. Please modify it urgently.

20.title: Profile picture upload fails with spaces in filename
20.description: Profile picture upload fails when image name contains spaces; frontend requests old name, causing API 404. Not a cache issue, but a bug in upload logic.
20.evidence_quote: The profile picture upload is indeed acting up. I figured out that it only happens if the image name contains spaces. The system renames it, but the frontend somehow requests the old, space-containing name from the API, which returns a 404.
20.subject: Project Phoenix - Staging Environment Anomaly
participants: Anna Kiss Kiss Anna <Anna Kiss kiss.anna@kisjozsitech.hu>

participants: Gábor Horváth Horvath Gabor <Gábor Horváth horvath.gabor@kisjozsitech.hu>
István Nagy Nagy Istvan <István Nagy nagy.istvan@kisjozsitech.hu>
Péter Kovács Kovacs Peter <Péter Kovács kovacs.peter@kisjozsitech.hu>
22.resolution_evidence: the test DB needs to be created manually beforehand; the hook itself doesn't do it. The create_test_db.sh script is in the scripts folder.
